Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is grey in section, the interior is slightly grooved and covered with a dark-brown resinous substance, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and faint traces of seven lines Coptic text written in black ink, containing an account of expenses, including offerings on behalf of the dead and alms.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.122)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87632) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87632)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 142 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
